top_insights: Critical context switching: 188.3 switches/hour on average (normal 20–40; critical >100), peak 408/hour.
Severe fragmentation: avg session 1.5 min; 49.8% of sessions under 45 seconds; 171 unique windows.
Work is spread across a 13-hour active span for 7.94h logged, increasing "always-on" load despite moderate total hours.
Circadian hygiene mostly intact (0% evening work); minor early-morning work (4.5%) could nibble at sleep if it grows.
Recent acute overload: 102 switches in 15 minutes (408/hour) with ~2–3 windows per interval, indicating ping‑ponging.

flags.message: Average 188.3 switches/hour (≈4.7× the high threshold and >9× the upper end of normal); peak 408/hour. This is not cognitively sustainable and will degrade accuracy, memory, and decision quality.
flags.prescription: Starting next session, run 25–40 min Focus blocks with Do Not Disturb on, only 1–2 windows visible, and batch comms at the top of each hour; target <80 switches/hour this week, <60/hour next.

flags.message: Half of all sessions are under 45 seconds and average session is 1.5 minutes, plus 171 unique windows—strong signal of micro‑tasking and attentional residue.
flags.prescription: Create 3 dedicated virtual desktops by project and keep only the active project visible during a block; collapse other tabs with OneTab (or equivalent) before each block.

flags.message: 7.94 hours of work spread over 13 active hours increases perceived workload and reduces recovery opportunities.
flags.prescription: Compress into a 9-hour work window (e.g., 08:30–17:30) and set a daily 15‑min shutdown ritual with a hard stop alarm; no reopening work apps after the stop.

flags.message: Only 15.4% of sessions exceed 3 minutes—far short of the sustained 60–90 min cycles associated with peak cognitive output.
flags.prescription: Schedule 3–4 protected cycles/day: 45–60 min single‑task focus + 10–15 min away‑from‑screen break; increase to 75–90 min as fragmentation drops.

flags.message: Zero evening work is protective; early‑morning work at 4.5% is minor but could erode sleep if it expands.
flags.prescription: Maintain a fixed sleep window and defer cognitive work until after 07:00 with 5–10 min of outdoor light; set a caffeine cutoff 8 hours before bedtime.

flags.message: 102 switches in the last 15 minutes indicates acute overload and loss of task control.
flags.prescription: If any 15‑min interval exceeds 80 switches, trigger a 5‑min walk + 1‑min box breathing (4‑4‑4‑4) + 3‑min plan reset; resume with one defined next action.

flags.message: 171 unique windows suggests too many concurrent contexts, elevating decision fatigue and errors.
flags.prescription: Daily cap: choose 3 priorities and at most 2 concurrent projects per half‑day; park everything else on a Later list reviewed at set times (11:30 and 16:30).
